alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 3:00PM EST until January 30 at 7:52AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River from Lafayette to Montezuma. .Lowland flooding is expected to develop along the upper Wabash this week from a combination of previous precipitation, snowmelt and additional rainfall on still frozen ground. Expected minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Five Crossings, a local county river park at old U.S. Highway 136 bridge site, begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning to a crest of 18.5 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Thursday morning by around 1100 AM EST.
